method.name: POST
method.doc: Registers a new temporary token on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the token, either a request_token (OAuth 1.0) or an authorization_code (OAuth 2.0) to be stored.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: the date this token expires (UNIX timestamp in seconds).

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the oauth_consumer_key for which this token was issued.

param.name: client_name
param.doc: the client name for which this token was issued.

param.name: callback
param.doc: the callback uri. 'redirect_uri' in OAuth 2.0. The parameter may be left empty

param.name: scope
param.doc: the scope used with OAuth 2.0. The parameter may be left empty

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner who granted this token. REQUIRED for OAuth 2.0 (authorization code), OPTIONAL for OAuth 1.0. The request_token is issued without a resource_owner involved.

param.name: secret
param.doc: the secret for this token. Optional because OAuth 2.0 does not have a secret if configured to issue BEARER tokens.

param.name: custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values. This is only supported for OAuth 2.0.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST

doc.title: Add an oauth_token in the context of OAuth 1.0

method.doc: Registers a new OAuth 1.0 token on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
This API adds the client_name and resource_owner associated with the temp_token.

param.name: token
param.doc: This is the oauth_token.

param.name: secret
param.doc: the shared secret for this token.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: the date this token expires (UNIX timestamp in seconds).

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the oauth_consumer_key for which this token was issued. It must match the oauth_consumer_key that has received the temporary token

param.name: status
param.doc: either ENABLED or DISABLED. DISABLED tokens will cause a request to fail.

param.name: temp_token
param.doc: the temporary token exchanged for this token.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST

doc.title: Add an access_token/ refresh_token in the context of OAuth 2.0

method.doc: Registers a new OAuth 2.0 access_token on the OAuth server. Optionally also a refresh_token.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
This API updates an existing token of the combination 'resource_owner - client_key'. The original token becomes invalid!

param.name: token
param.doc: This is the access_token.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: the date this token expires (timestamp in seconds).

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_id for which this token was issued.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner who granted this token. For tokens issued via 'client_credentials' flow this should be the client name.

param.name: status
param.doc: either ENABLED or DISABLED. DISABLED tokens will cause a request to fail.

param.name: scope
param.doc: the scope that was granted.

param.name: client_name
param.doc: the client name for which this token was issued.

param.name: secret
param.doc: the shared secret for this token. Not used with token profile 'BEARER'.

param.name: custom
param.doc: A JSON structure containing custom values.

param.name: rtoken
param.doc: the refresh token.

param.name: rexpiration
param.doc: the date this refresh token expires (timestamp in seconds). This is required if 'rtoken' is provided.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Updates token status on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the oauth_token or access_token to be updated.

param.name: status
param.doc: either ENABLED or DISABLED. DISABLED tokens will cause a request to fail.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Sets the resources_owner associated with the request_token in the context of OAuth 1.0 on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the OAuth 1.0 request_token after it has been authorized by a resource_owner.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner who authorized this token.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Sets the verifier associated with the request_token in the context of OAuth 1.0 on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the OAuth 1.0 request_token to receive a verifier.

param.name: expiration
param.doc: the date this token expires (timestamp in seconds).

param.name: verifier
param.doc: the verifier to to be assigned to the token.

response.doc: A verifier for this token has been set already.
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Valid parameter combinations: either 'token' or 'rtoken' or 'resource_owner' or 'client_key' or 'resource_owner and client_key'

param.name: token
param.doc: the oauth_token or access_token to be revoked. MUST be used on its own

param.name: rtoken
param.doc: the refresh_token to be revoked. MUST be used on its own

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner whose long-living tokens should all be revoked. Can be used with 'client_key'

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key of which all temporary and long-living tokens should be revoked. MAY be used with 'resource_owner'

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Only ONE of the parameters can and MUST be used.

param.name: token
param.doc: the oauth_token or access_token to be deleted.

param.name: rtoken
param.doc: the refresh_token to be deleted.

param.name: temp_token
param.doc: the temporary token to be deleted.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key of which all temporary and long-living tokens should be deleted.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: disables all token that were issued to the given client_id.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key of which all long-living tokens should be disabled (status=DISABLED).

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of tokens selected by value.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Only one of the parameters can and must be used in addition to 'offset' and 'format'.

param.name: token
param.doc: the oauth_token or access_token to be retrieved. 'offset' is ignored.

param.name: rtoken
param.doc: the refresh_token to be retrieved. 'offset' is ignored.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: all tokens that have been granted by this resource_owner.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key of which all long-living tokens should be retrieved.

param.name: status
param.doc: get all tokens with the given status.

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of tokens selected by client_id and resource_owner.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: all tokens that have been granted by this resource_owner.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the client_key of which all long-living tokens should be retrieved.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Get the values of tokens selected by token status and resource_owner.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: all tokens that have been granted by this resource_owner.

param.name: status
param.doc: get all tokens with the given status.

param.name: offset
param.doc: The API returns up to 100 values. This parameter is the query offset which can be used for pagination purposes.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET

doc.title: Get temporary tokens by token and verifier

method.doc: Get the values of temporary tokens selected by a token.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the request_token (OAuth 1.0) or authorization_code (OAuth 2.0) to be retrieved.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET

doc.title: Get temporary tokens by token and verifier

method.doc: Get the values of temporary tokens selected by token and optional verifier. This is valid in the context of OAuth 1.0

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.

param.name: token
param.doc: the authorized request_token.

param.name: verifier
param.doc: the verifier issued for the token.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET

doc.title: DEPRECATED: Get temporary tokens by client_id and resource_owner

method.doc: Get the values of temporary tokens selected by client_id and resource_owner.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
This request only returns a result if any temporary token issued has not been used. Usually this table is empty since clients exchange the temporary token for a long living token immediately.
This API accepts 'client_key' or 'resource_owner' or both at once. One has to be used at least.

param.name: client_key
param.doc: the oauth_consumer_key (OAuth 1.0) or client_id (OAuth 2.0) of which all temporary tokens should be retrieved. This can be used without 'resource_owner'.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: all tokens that have been granted by this resource_owner. This can be used without 'client_key'.

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Registers a new JWT (id_token) on the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
The API will replace/update an existing JWT if the combination of 'resource_owner - azp' already exists in the case of an id_token.

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner for whom this token was issued.

param.name: azp
param.doc: a single value or space-separated list of valid users for this token.

param.name: iss
param.doc: the issuing server URL, such as: server.ca.com.

param.name: jwt
param.doc: the complete JWT.

param.name: sub
param.doc: the 'sub'ject if the JWT is an id_token.

param.name: salt
param.doc: the salt value used to generate the 'sub'ject value if the JWT is an id_token.

param.name: shared_secret
param.doc: the shared secret used to sign the JWT.

param.name: shared_secret_type
param.doc: the shared secret type used to sign the JWT. For example, the algorithm that was used: 'HS256'.

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Looks up a JWT (id_token) from the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
The API will return a JWT based on given parameters.

param.name: jwt
param.doc: the complete JWT. This parameter has to be used o its own if it is used!

param.name: azp
param.doc: a single or space separated list of valid users for this token. This parameter MUST be used with 'sub' or 'resource_owner'.

param.name: sub
param.doc: the 'sub'ject if the JWT is an id_token. This parameter MUST be used with 'azp'

param.name: resource_owner
param.doc: the resource_owner for whom this token was issued. This parameter MUST be used with 'azp'

param.name: format
param.doc: Either 'xml' or 'json'. The response is returned in the requested format.

response.doc: An XML response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
A JSON response that includes the element 'values'. 'value' appears once, multiple times, or not at all (indicating no values found).
If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Removes a JWT (id_token) from the OAuth server.

request.doc: Authentication is done via ssl mutual authentication.
Only one of the parameters can be and has to be used in addition to 'logout_apps'.

param.name: jwt
param.doc: the complete JWT.

param.name: azp
param.doc: the azp value.

param.name: logout_apps
param.doc: [MAG]: if set to 'true', all oauth token issued to 'azp' will be removed. This parameter is valid in the context of MAG and Mobile SSO only!

response.doc: If any required parameters or headers are missing, the request will fail.
The path component is invalid.
Authentication failed.
The client could not be authenticated.
The HTTP method is not valid

param.name: Allow
param.doc: This header is required by RFC 2616 and contains a comma separated list of valid HTTP methods.

response.doc: Unknown error.
